qas.question: What are two other dangerous acids?
What temperature does hydrogen react with these elements?

context: H2 reacts with every oxidizing element. Hydrogen can react spontaneously and violently at <a1_0>room temperature<a1_0/> with chlorine and fluorine to form the corresponding hydrogen halides, <a0_0>hydrogen chloride and hydrogen fluoride<a0_0/>, which are also potentially dangerous acids.
